intro: Plagiobothrys micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland desert regions. Its flowers are usually pale blue to violet in color and bloom in the spring. Plagiobothrys micranthus is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local pollinator populations.
